name: Bacon-Bleu Cheese Ball
author: marion
summary: A zesty bleu-cheese, bacon, and onion cheese ball. Best served with multi-grain crackers. The recipe I reworked for this cheese ball called for 1 pound of bacon fried, drained, and crumbled. I didn't have time for all that, so used the bacon bits and found them at least as good and less mess. Make sure your cream cheese is really soft, or else it is a little hard to mix well. Bon Appetit!
ingredients: 1 (3 ounce) package bacon bits (such as Oscar Mayer®)
¼ cup blue cheese salad dressing, or to taste
¼ cup dried parsley, or as needed  (Optional)
directions: Stir cream cheese, bacon bits, blue cheese, salad dressing, green onions, and garlic powder together in a bowl
Form mixture into 2 balls, cover each with plastic wrap, and refrigerate until chilled and firm, 3 hours or overnight
Remove cheese balls from plastic wrap and roll in parsley
